description: Set wall or facet extra variables. The extra variable can be of any type (string, integer, float, vector) and is associated with the index i as if stored in an array. The optional facet keyword can be given before the optional range to specify that the extra variable will be applied to facets. In this case, the range is applied to the facets and not to walls.

keywords.name: facet
keywords.description: Apply extra variable to facets instead of walls. When specified, range applies to facets

examples.description: Set extra variable slot 1 to string 'Fred' for all walls
Set extra variable slot 2 to float 3.45 for all walls
Set extra variable slot 3 to integer 3 for all walls
Set extra variable slot 4 to 2D vector (3.14, 2.38) for all walls
Set extra variable slot 5 to 3D vector (90, 100, 110) for all walls
Set extra variable slot 1 to 'boundary' for facets with IDs 1-10
Set extra variable slot 10 to FISH variable value for walls named 'container'

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: Wall.set_extra(slot, value) or Facet.set_extra(slot, value) - requires iteration over wall/facet range
